results.title: Japan inc: lessons for North America?
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, John Taylor, John Coney, Peter Jones and Kalle Lasn
results.brief_description: Organization, discipline and productivity in Japan are on a scale not known in any other country of the world. For the 110 million people of Japan, survival means doing things together—a concept that has seen that nation automate and computerize at an unparalleled rate. Just how this level of achievement was reached is the subject of this absorbing documentary study of Japanese business and industry.

results.title: Japan in winter
results.brief_description: Japan in winter is a busy time of the year with preparations for the celebration of the New Year (Japan’s equivalent of Christmas time). This is the time when the most colorful festivals take place all over the country and the people make great preparations for the ceremonies. On New Year’s Day the shrines and streets are crowded as millions of Japanese take part in winter celebrations.

results.title: Japan behind the mask: a special report by John Pilger
results.brief_description: John Pilger presents a two-part look at the “real” Japan, at working and living conditions, at education, the status of women and at nationalism. Pilger demonstrates that behind the public relations image of a high tech, happy population, employed for life by benevolent big brother companies, lies the private truth of powerless unions, small companies, unemployment, inequality between the sexes, pollution, educational pressure and escalating expenditure on armaments. Yet in spite of all this, the everyday kindness, modesty and grace of the Japanese people is unaffected.

results.title: Japan's surrender
results.brief_description: Documentary profiling the USA’s victory over Japan through atomic warfare during World War II and their eventual surrender signifying the end of the War. Edited by Eugene W. Castle.

results.title: Japan's living craft
results.brief_description: Explores an extensive range of traditional Japanese folk art. Originally created to fulfill the needs of daily life, this work has survived the centuries to become an integral part of Modern Japanese culture. The artisans, considered living cultural treasures by the Japanese government, let their imaginations work in many media and styles. Each craft has its highly developed skill and each its own set of tools, often made by the artisan. Includes ceramics, iron casting, dyeing and weaving of delicate cloth, construction of paper dolls and the creation of lacquerware. Shows that the traditional loom, less efficient and more cumbersome than its mechanised counterpart, is incomparable when it comes to making material. An incredibly dextrous woman, nearly blinded by age, work nimbly and painstakingly at the loosening of long ramie fibres in order to make one long continuous thread. Also shows the cutting of patterns for the dyeing of fabrics; the powdered gold and silver creations of ‘makie’ lacquerware; the many and varied ideaas created for kimono fabrics.

results.title: Japan's art from the land
results.creator_credit: Holt, Rinehart and Winston, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Hugh Gage
results.brief_description: The famous artist Shuson Kono, paints a mountain landscape capturing the serenity of nature in the still muted-toned ponds that border the Katsura, the 17th century Imperial Palace. Bamboo flutes and vocal chorus intensify the deeply reflective mood of this poetic film. Also includes images of rural Japan and illustrates the designing of various Japanese gardens.

results.title: Janus
results.creator_credit: James Garrett and Partners, Michael Birkett and Anthony Wilkinson
results.brief_description: This film was made for the European Architectural Heritage Year and has no spoken commentary. It considers the character of the European heritage, its neglect through indifference and its destruction through vandalism throughout the ages.

results.title: January 26 - A.B Original (2016)
results.brief_description: January 26 was the hit single for hip hop duo A.B Original, which is made up of Briggs and Trials. In their debut album Reclaim Australia they frequently address issues facing Indigenous Australians.

constellations_other.name: Outlaws and the end
constellations_other.description: Tracing connections from Sweet Country to Australian westerns and resistance to white colonial narratives.

results.title: Jane Fonda's Workout: Low Impact Aerobics
results.brief_description: The video is a low impact aerobics class designed to teach your body to burn fat, improve your cardiovascular fitness, muscle strength and flexibility. The class is taken by Jane Fonda and was conceived in consultation with Dr. James Garrick, Director of the Dance and Sports Medicine Centre at St. Francis Hospital, San Francisco.
